result.execSummary:
The defendant Oscar E. DeLisle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Discharge Firearm/Vehicle-Bldg/Vehicle, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(3)(a)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Conditions of probation will apply if revoked

miscConds.notes:
Supervision fees
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Oscar E. DeLisle

records.addlTxt:
01:39 PM Defendant Oscar E. DeLisle in court with attorney Elizabeth Svehlek.  Defendant Oscar E. DeLisle in custody. Mary Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 14cf08, 14cf09, 18cm326, 18tr2859, 18tr2860. 
In 18cm326 - Attorney Svehlek has not prepared Plea Questionnaire. Defendant enters guilty plea. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.
In 14cf08 and 14cf09 - All parties in receipt of revocation packet. 
Sowinski notes that 14cf09 was an imposed and stayed sentence and sentencing is not necessary today. Court concurs. 

Adj. 2:21 p.m.
1-11-19 Sentencing Hearing on Revocation
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 11, 2019 at 01:30 pm.
revoked
Amended
includes revocation summary and cover letter

records.addlTxt:
11:34 am - Defendant Oscar E. DeLisle in court with attorney Richard J. Shawl.  Defendant Oscar E. DeLisle in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf08 and 14cf09.  In case 14cf08 - State moves to amend Count 1 to "simple" Burglary 943.10(1) a Class F Felony and amend Count 2 to Misdemeanor Theft, removing Special Facts - Granted.  Defendant pleads guilty.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty Plea questionnaire filed.  Bednar/Shawl/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence - 14CF08
Count 1 - CS To Sentence Currently Serving
WHS/POP 5 yrs
Court Costs/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
Jail 1 yr - May serve in any Wisconsin County - W/Huber for all purposes - court will not object to 24 hour furlough for birth of child
Apology Letter
May not be on Mel's Trading Post premises or contact with owner and/or employees
AODA assessment and recovery
Restitution $1,677.70 (Includes 10% surcharge)
Community Service 100 hours
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Counts 2 & 3
WHS/POP 2 yrs - CC to Count 1
Court Costs/Supervision Fees
Apology Letter
AODA assessment and recovery
May not be on Mel's Trading Post premises or contact with owner and/or employees
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Court Sentence - 14CF09 - CC to 14cf08
Impose and Stay WSP 6 yrs - 3 yrs Initial Confinement - 3 yrs Extended Supervision
Probation 5 yrs
Court Costs/Supervision Fees
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights, NADVI given

10:42 am - Defendant Oscar E. DeLisle in court with attorney Richard J. Shawl.  Defendant Oscar E. DeLisle in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf08 and 14cf09.  State calls David Jordan from the City of Wausau PD/Sworn/Direct by Bednar - State submits to Court Exhibit 1 (Canine Certification for 2013) and Exhibit 2 (Certification for 2012) - Marked and Rec'd - Witness ID's defendant/Cross by Shawl.  State called Matthew Van-Lieshout from the City of Wausau PD/Sworn/Direct by Bednar/Cross by Shawl.  Court accepts Defense offer of proof to locked glove box.  Shawl/Bednar statement to motion.  Court finds probable cause does exist.  Court denies motion.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 18, 2014 at 11:30 am.

9:36 a.m. Defendant Oscar E. DeLisle in court with attorney Richard J. Shawl.  Jodie L. Bednar, Asst. D.A., appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 14CF8. State calls Ted Knoeck, Lieutenant Marathon Co. Sheriff's Dept., sworn, direct. Witness identifies defendant; counsel stipulate to identification. Cross by Shawl. Questioned by the Court. Shawl/Bednar statement. Court statement - finds traffic stop was legal. Discussion regarding canine officer. State requests continuance; granted. Counsel to get hearing from JA. 10:21 adj.

01:33 pm - Defendant Oscar E. DeLisle in court with attorney Richard J. Shawl.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf08 and 14cf09.  Shawl recently appointed.  Motion hearing requested and scheduled for the 9th - will not proceed with sentencing until after Motion Hearing.  Bail continued.
motion
States Reply to Discovery

01:37 pm - Defendant Oscar E. DeLisle in court with attorney Mary Burns.   Michael W Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.   Calling 14cf08 and 14cf09.  Burns in receipt of Information, waives reading and enters not guilty pleas.  Bail continued. Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

03:42 pm - Defendant Oscar E. DeLisle in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael W Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf08 and 14cf09.  Voorhees - In receipt of Information, waives reading - Voorhees states defendant is requesting change of counsel and requests another Arraignment date.  Bail continued.  Arraignment scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 01:15 pm. - Adjourned 03:44 pm
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

10:36 am - Defendant Oscar E. DeLisle in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Susan J Sommer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14CF08 and 14CF09.  Voorhees moves to sequester witnesses - Granted.  Sommer request Chiamulera sit at prosecution table as Court Officer - Court grants.  Voorhees statement - Defendant has requested substitution of counsel - request made 12 days ago - PD's office has not been able to find another attorney to take over case - Defendant willing to proceed on today's date with current attorney.   State moves to consolidate cases for the purposes of today's preliminary hearing - Granted.  State calls Jacob Simkins, RPD Sgt./Sworn/Direct by Sommer/Cross by Voorhees.  State calls RPD Detective Sgt. Joshua Chiamulera/Sworn/Direct by Sommer - Witness ID's defendant/Cross by Voorhees/Redirect by Sommer/Recross by Voorhees.  In case 14cf08 - Court finds probable cause does exist and binds defendant over for trial.  In 14CF09 - Voorhees moves to dismiss.  Court denies motion and finds probable case does exist and binds defendant over for trial.  State files Information.  Voorhees and Defendant - In receipt of Information - Voorhees to forward Information to successor counsel for purposes of Arraignment.  Bail continued.  Arraignment scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 9, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

11:34 am - Attorney John E. Voorhees in court.  Defendant does not appear.  Susan J. Sommer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14ct08 and 14cf09.  Sommer states failed to generate an Order to Produce - Defendant is in custody - Marathon County.  Bail continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2014 at 11:30 am.
may not possess any firearms, no contact w/Mel's Trading Post

02:14 pm - Defendant Oscar E. DeLisle in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Oscar E. DeLisle in custody.  Michael W Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf08 and 14cf09.  Voorhees -   In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
.  Schiek/Voorhees to bond.  Court sets sig bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 5, 2014 at 11:30 am.

01:48 pm - Attorney John E Voorhees in court.  Susan J Sommer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf08 and 14cf09.  Voorhees states defendant is incarcerated in Marathon County Jail.  Voorhees in receipt of complaints, waives reading requests adjournment.  Court authorizes warrant and adjourns to next Monday.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
